thread.title: UP elections: At Budaun, hits out at SP with 'boys make mistakes'
thread.title_full: UP elections: At Budaun, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hits out at SP with 'boys make mistakes' | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017 - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: UP elections: At Budaun, hits out at SP with 'boys make mistakes'
text:
NEW DELHI:   on Saturday tore into Akhilesh Yadav's government, alleging it was playing with aspirations of youth of the state for political gains. 

"Akhilesh Yadav government is playing with the aspirations of youth for its political gains. The Uttar   has been sheltering the criminals and goons in the state," Prime Minister Modi   rally in Budaun . 

The Prime Minister also questioned the 'poor' development Samajwadi Party's stronghold Budaun. 

"Budaun is among 100 backward districts. I had heard about Budaun when I was in Gujarat as the state's CM). What is the reason that fruits of development could not be able to reach this land under the regime of Samajwadi Party and Bahujan Samaj Party," Modi said. 

Modi also launched a scathing attack at the SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav . 

"A SP MLA from Budaun levelled serious allegations against SP MP and if a reporter approaches Mulayam ji for comment. He would've said that boys make mistakes," PM Modi said. 

In 2014, Mulayam shocked the entire nation when he said that boys make mistakes to express his protest against anti-rape law. 

On Friday, Prime Minister had said that the truth of Uttar   will be exposed on March 11 when the results of the elections will be declared. 

Condemning the incident of imprisoning BJP workers, the Prime Minister had also said that the Samajwadi Party is misusing law for its own benefit. 

"Is the government used like this? BJP workers were forcibly imprisoned. Who misuses law for its personal motive?" he said.(ANI)
